neighbors.name: Beau Martin & Jessica Martin
neighbors.claims: Beau Martin is an Orleans-area farmer and auctioneer who operates Martin Auction Co. with his father, Lyle Martin ([Martin Auction Co.](https://martin-auctionco.com/aboutus.html)). He received approximately $46,691 in USDA farm subsidies from 1995 to 2024 ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?page=3&z=1&zip=68966)). Jessica Martin is listed as a co-owner of a horse with Beau Martin ([Nebraska RHA](https://nebraskarha.org/ultimate-auction/jm-rowdy-blue-leo/)). No public records were found of Beau or Jessica Martin speaking in local meetings regarding the Harlan County wind/solar moratoriums discussed in 2023-2024 ([Harlan County Minutes](https://harlancounty.ne.gov/posting_files/pdfs/board/minutes/2023/20230418_101136_board_minutes.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage his role as a local auctioneer and business owner. Approach with a focus on economic opportunities for the local community and respect for agricultural operations. His business background suggests he may value clear, fair contracting terms.

citations.claim: Operates Martin Auction Co. with his father
citations.title: Martin Auction Co. About Us

neighbors.name: Carol A. Wells
neighbors.claims: Carol A. Wells was an absentee landowner who lived in Grand Island and passed away on October 31, 2021, at age 88 ([Apfel Funeral Home](https://www.apfelfuneralhome.com/obituaries/carol-a-wells)). She maintained her primary residence outside Harlan County, and her estate or heirs (children Susan Vigil and Jay Wells) likely manage the property interests now ([Apfel Funeral Home](https://www.apfelfuneralhome.com/obituaries/carol-a-wells)). There is no record of her involvement in recent Harlan County development discussions.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the heirs (Susan Vigil or Jay Wells) regarding the estate's land management goals. Focus on asset preservation and minimal disruption to the property's value or future transferability.

neighbors.name: Bart A. Woodward & Jill R. Woodward
neighbors.claims: Bart A. Woodward is a professional Associate Broker and Certified General Appraiser with Agri Affiliates, Inc., based in Kearney, NE ([Agri Affiliates](https://agriaffiliates.com/agents/bart-woodward-ara/)). He and his wife, Jill R. Woodward, reside in Minden (Kearney County), where Jill is identified as his spouse in family obituaries ([Ludvigsen Mortuary](https://www.ludvigsenmortuary.com/memorialpage.asp?id=2533)). Bart Woodward specializes in agricultural real estate sales and management, indicating a professional interest in land value and usage ([Agri Affiliates](https://agriaffiliates.com/agents/bart-woodward-ara/)). No public statements regarding the Harlan County renewable moratorium were found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Bart Woodward as an industry professional. He will likely have a sophisticated understanding of land valuation, leases, and contracts. Focus on the financial specifics, decommissioning assurances, and how the project impacts long-term land value.

citations.claim: Associate Broker and Appraiser at Agri Affiliates
citations.title: Agri Affiliates Agent Profile: Bart Woodward

citations.claim: Jill R. Woodward identified as spouse
citations.title: Obituary for Joel Walter Marreel

neighbors.name: Jesse R. Hays & Jill C. Hays
neighbors.claims: Jesse R. Hays is an Orleans-area resident who has worked in construction, including as a framer for Cedar Creek Construction, and has identified as a small business owner ([Bold.pro Resume](https://ne.bold.pro/my/jesse-haysres)). He held a Nebraska contractor’s license (No. 19341) ([BuildZoom](https://www.buildzoom.com/contractor/jesse-hays)). There are no public records of the Hays couple taking positions on development or participating in county meetings related to land use.

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight potential benefits to the local economy and opportunities for local trades when communicating with the Hays household. Discussing potential construction-related economic spinoffs may align with his professional background.

citations.claim: Small business owner and construction background
citations.title: Jesse Hays Resume

neighbors.name: Gary L. Stoelting & James G. Stoelting
neighbors.claims: Gary L. Stoelting and James G. Stoelting are brothers and part of a long-standing farm family in the Orleans area, confirmed by the obituary of their brother John A. Stoelting ([Valley Voice](https://www.valleyvoicene.com/news/john-stoelting)). The Stoelting Farms operation is active in Harlan County, receiving significant USDA subsidies, including over $1.5 million for Gary Stoelting and $1.8 million for James Stoelting from 1995-2024 ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?z=1&zip=68966&page=0)). They have not publicly voiced opinions on local development in available records, but their multi-generational tenure and large-scale operation suggest they hold informal influence.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Stoeltings with respect for their family’s extensive agricultural legacy. Given the scale of their operation, they may be interested in the financial stability offered by land leases, provided it does not disrupt their core farming activities.
